thread.title: Cardinals leave for long NFL road trip
thread.title_full: Cardinals leave for long NFL road trip

author: David Kelly
title: Cardinals leave for long NFL road trip
text:
Cardinals leave for long NFL road trip Posted: TUCSON, AZ (Tucson News Now) - 
Birds fly south for the winter. 
The Cardinals are flying east, but for only two weeks. 
Arizona will stay in West Virginia following Sundayâ€™s game against the Detriot Lions. The Cardinals play at Pittsburgh a week from Sunday and head coach Bruce Arians preferred bunkering at the New Orleans Saints training facility at the Greenbrier Resort in West Sulphur Springs. 
This will be the third time the Cardinals have not returned to Phoenix in between two road games in the east. 
They did it, under Ken Whisenhunt, during the 2008 Super Bowl season in between road losses at Washington and the New York Jets. 
And again two years ago in Bruce Arians first season with Arizona in between a loss to New Orleans and a win over Tampa Bay. Sunday, October 11 2015 12:58 AM EDT 2015-10-11 04:58:41 GMT (Source: Rebecca Sasnett / Arizona Athletics) Arizona moved to 4-2 (1-2 Pac-12) after a 44-7 win over Oregon State Saturday. Arizona moved to 4-2 (1-2 Pac-12) after a 44-7 win over Oregon State Saturday. Birds flying east for two weeks on the road The Cardinals will bunker down at the Saints training facility in West Virginia in between their road dates with the Lions and Steelers. The Cardinals will bunker down at the Saints training facility in West Virginia in between their road dates with the Lions and Steelers.
